page.title: 03 BEEF FARMING
page.content: {NORTHFIELD FARM,LITTLE CARLTON This 200 acre farm is mainly for beef production.Mr.Willson grows wheat, barley,oats, and grass for hay.He has 120 cattle including 50 breeding Lincoln Red cows. In April 1985 he had 55 calves.Of these 35 had been born since Christmas 1984. He had two bulls,a Lincoln Red called Carlton King and a Limouzan(a French breed).He sends the beasts when fully grown,2yrs old,to market or to the butcher.At this stage each beast weighs between 450kg and 500kg and is worth Â£450 to Â£500. He feeds the animals on crushed concentrates,hay and barley.He employs one helper.He takes his prize Lincoln Red cattle to shows like The Lincolnshire Agricultural Show and has won many prizes.
